instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.ISL9239: What is ISL9239? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2016-2018 responsible for charging the battery and creating the power rail PPBUS_G3H.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.C7050: What is C7050? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for battery current sensing, you should measure around 2.202 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Hi guys. 

I have this <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with no power stuck at 20V 0amps. No liquid damage. The <CHIP>ISL9239</CHIP>(<CHIP>U7000</CHIP>) was heating up a bit and I replaced it, one contact under it was gone, Pin 36 <SIGNAL>TBA_GATE_Q1</SIGNAL>. Also, I have replaced <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> cause it was heating up. Now I have the same state no power 20v. I noticed that <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is not going up and stays at 0.8v up to 1v variation, and there's no short measurement with diode mode. <CHIP>U4200</CHIP> had some dust and looks funny on the edges it peeled off. The strange thing that I found on the board
it's a component under <RESISTOR>R4308</RESISTOR> which is not on the board view, but I'm guessing on the schematics it's XW4300 and it should be going to ground.  

Any suggestions would be appreciated, thank you üôè

 [ATTACH type="full" width="319px" alt="<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> ISL"]61265[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Diode mode to ground at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>?

Remove F7000/1 and check <CAPACITOR>C7050</CAPACITOR> voltage.
Check/replace <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR>/40.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message: I replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> now powers on, thank you very much  üôè :cool:

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message: I suspected <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> because the Gate of high-side MOSFET was left on air.
